definition: qigong, a system of deep breathing exercises
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Most likely, these folks were engaging in their morningqigong.
sentences.chinese: 这些人极有可能在练习气功。

sentences.english: This theory has become the theoretical framework for China’s current qigong and health preservation studies.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论已成为当今气功健身研究的基础理论。

sentences.english: That sounds like Chinese breath exercise.
Practice yoga, tai chi, or Qigong.
sentences.chinese: 练习瑜伽，太极或者气功。

sentences.english: Qigong exercises in the fitness process, how can we do for static?
sentences.chinese: 在健身气功锻炼过程中，怎样才能求静呢？

sentences.english: I participated in Qi Gong training class in my junior year.
sentences.chinese: 我在三年级时曾参加过气功训练班。

sentences.english: Qigong magazines have Master's picture, does a Law Body exist on it?
sentences.chinese: 气功杂志封面上有老师的像，也有法身存在吗？

sentences.english: So the friend called his wife out to talk to the chi-kung master.
sentences.chinese: 所以朋友就叫他的妻子出来跟气功师谈谈。

sentences.english: Finally, a simulation example of aerodynamic parameter estimation for elastic aircraft is given.
sentences.chinese: 最后给出了弹性飞行器气功参数估计的一个仿真算例。

sentences.english: In Zhineng Qigong, meditation is mainly about concentrating on practice.
sentences.chinese: 智能气功讲的入静，主要是指集中精神练功。

sentences.english: My grandma practices Qi Gong in the park early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 我祖母每天一大早在公园练气功。

sentences.english: True parties of'inborn Chi Kung'only so-so, Joe's master accepted.
sentences.chinese: 真派的‘先天气功’不过如此，乔老爷领教了。

sentences.english: He spends his mornings drawing, and his afternoons doing chi-gong.
sentences.chinese: 他早上画画，下午练气功。

sentences.english: In their eyes, we four are the so-called "four evil persons".
sentences.chinese: 在他们看来，这四个人是伪气功者所说的四大恶人。

sentences.english: When we practice Qigong or meditation, the mind should strive for non-doing.
sentences.chinese: 当我们联系气功和冥想时，脑中就应该达到无为。

sentences.english: I first adjusted his meditating techniques and then taught him the self healing Qigong.
sentences.chinese: 我先教导他一些入静的技巧，接着便教他自疗气功。

definition: shadowboxing or Taiji, T'aichi or T'aichichuan/traditional form of physical exercise or relaxation/a martial art
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
"eight pieces of brocade," a set of qigong exercises with assumed medical benefits
a kind of traditional Chinese sword-play
the Absolute or Supreme Ultimate, the source of all things according to some interpretations of Chinese mythology
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)

military skill or technique (in former times)/all kinds of martial art sports (some claiming spiritual development)/self-defense/tradition of choreographed fights from opera and film (recent usage)/also called kungfu 功夫/CL:種|种[zhong3]
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
